svcproc.title: 08WEE - SWITCH, AIR HORN, PASSENGER, FIRE TRUCK
svcproc.para: 08WEE - SWITCH, AIR HORN, PASSENGER Fire Truck Application; Switch Located in Instrument Panel (IP) Close to Passenger; Driver Also To Activate Switch at Steering Wheel

The passenger side air horn switch provides a method for an individual to activate the vehicle air horn from the passenger seat. The feature consists of a hard wired momentary switch that is located in the lower right corner of the central IP. This second rocker switch is used in conjunction with the air horn switch that is located in the steering wheel.
The air horn software feature code 595ALD must be enabled on the vehicle Body Controller (BC) using the Diamond Logic® Builder software (see local dealer).
There are no programmable parameters associated with this feature.

Both the hard wired rocker switch in the IP and the air horn switch in the steering wheel are connected to a single input on the BC connector 1602 Pin F8. The air solenoid is driven from the BC output connector 1602 Pin E12.

item.para: Turn the Ignition (IGN) key to the accessory position.
Momentarily depress the air horn switch in the steering wheel. Note that the air horn sounds.
Momentarily depress the air horn rocker switch. Note that the air horn sounds.

step1.para: Remove the central IP trim piece.
Locate an open switch position in the lower right corner of the IP.
Use a switch hole punching tool to cut a hole in the plastic plate of the central IP plate.

Remove the storage box or 12-pack of switches located above plastic plate. Use a scribe or other marker tool to outline the hard wired switch openings in the steel plate located behind the plastic switch plate.
Drill a pilot hole in the center of the desired switch location.
Use the switch punch to open the hole in the plastic plate. The recommended method to create a rectangular switch slot is to use a Green Lee Punch (part number ZTSE4426 from SPX).
Insert the air horn switch in the plastic plate.
Wire the mating switch connector as Circuit Diagram Manual S08322, Chapter 4 Cab Accessories, Horn - Electric.
Attach the switch connector to the air horn switch.
Reinstall the plastic switch plate and central IP trim piece.
